article.title: Synaptic noise induces intermittent oscillatory-quiescent state transitions in a spiking network model

multiple_choice_question.text: Which of the following neuronal classes exhibits the highest firing frequency in the given time window?
In which scenario does the network exhibit a relatively constant network activity state with asynchronous and non-oscillatory firing?
What does the histogram in Panel H represent?
choices: Distribution of the average voltage of neurons
Distribution of the membrane recovery variable u
Distribution of stay duration in the collective up and down states
Distribution of firing rates of excitatory and inhibitory neurons

multiple_choice_question.text: Which type of neuron, when driven by synaptic noise, exhibits a faster first spike time for any given noise intensity?
choices: Both exhibit similar first spike times
Cannot be determined from the figure

multiple_choice_question.text: According to Eq. (10), what factors contribute to the "balance" of synaptic input in a network with different neuron types?
choices: Ratio of synaptic increments (g<sub>ex</sub>/g<sub>in</sub>) and number of connections (C<sub>ex</sub>/C<sub>in</sub>) only
Firing rates of excitatory and inhibitory populations (ν<sub>ex</sub>/ν<sub>in</sub>) only
All of the above factors contribute to the balance
